contextId.information: Bending down often symbolizes being humiliated. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: Man will be forced to bend down

contextId.information: They do this to show their extreme sadness. AT: "they wear sackcloth and mourn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
The Moabites will send rams to the king of Judah so that he might protect them from the enemy army. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: Send rams to the ruler of the land

contextId.information: Hezekiah's officials tore their clothes as a sign of mourning and distress. The meaning of this can be made clear.  AT: "with their clothes torn because they were extremely distressed" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This is a gesture of scorn. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
